This fund supports youths with mental health issues in need of therapy. Since its inception on 1.1.19, this fund has raised more than $100000 - which will pay for more than two thousand hours of therapy! It has also helped twenty at-risk youths, some of whom have been stopped from completing suicide by caseworkers from Limitless. The Food Pantry 2.0 serves as an automated platform to dispense emergency food aid 24/7 to those in need. The machine provides free food for 200 people, including needy residents and seniors with mobility issues so they can get their meals more conveniently. The initiative is supported by non-profit group The Food Bank Singapore and various grassroots and social service organisations.

WE CARE treats all forms of addictions including drugs, alcohol, and compulsive behaviours like problem gambling, compulsive sex behaviours & porn use, overeating, problematic internet use & excessive gaming and shoplifting. We take a holistic approach to help people live an addiction-free life. We offer evidence-based counselling and therapy group work. WE CARE is also a community-based drop-in centre where a safe, supportive and non-judgemental environment is provided for individuals to stabilise and work on their recovery.

Scheme: Focus on the family - Programmes and online tools
Description: Focus on the Family Singapore Limited is a donor-supported Institution of Public Character (IPC) dedicated to helping families thrive. We believe the family unit is the basic building block of a thriving nation. We partner individuals and organizations to strengthen family relationships through differentiated programs, trusted resources, family Counselling and content placement in various media. Our desire is to witness the powerful transformation of our society through healthy and positive family values today, and for generations to come.

PSALT Care Ltd (pronounced as ëSalt-careí), is a charity organisation set up to support and sustain persons with diagnosed mental health and addiction challenges, whom we refer to as ëclientsí, in their recovery journey. It is a fundamental belief in PSALT Care that recovery is possible. Recovery involves supporting clients, as they continue with the medication prescribed by their doctors, through modalities such as psychotherapy, mental health education and group support sessions. 

PSALT Care endeavours to support its clients by means of organising peer-led support group meetings which are facilitated by formally trained, volunteer Peer Support Specialists. These small group sessions, each comprising between 12-16 clients, meet regularly to briefly discuss a mental health topic and encourage one another in their recovery journey. Speaking with empathy from their own lived experiences, the peers and their facilitator share a common bond and sphere of encouragement that non-peers may not fully appreciate.

Scheme: Betsyís PLACE (Peer Life Activity Centre for Empowerment)
Description: An Activity Hub to provide support and build skills to aid peers in recovery and integration to society and Short-term residential respite haven for peers facing stressful life events without family support

Developed in 2014, the Yellow Brick Road (YBR) Programme aims to reduce the detrimental impacts of incarceration on families and children of inmates. This is done through the provision of parenting workshops, family bonding activities and case management services for families. The programme also targets the social-emotional development of offendersí children through enrichment activities, group work, and group / one-to-one tuition. Available at various social service agencies islandwide. YBR is a programme for families of offenders with children between the ages of 7 to 12. Accepted families should be committed to participating throughout the entire course of the programme, which will last for a duration of 2 years.

NHSKids conducts free health screening for children aged 6 and below, at a centralised location and also door-to-door. Follow-up is conducted for children and families who were highlighted to us during the health screening to require more referral to services. NHSKids aims to educate both parents and children on some of the developmental needs of children, parenting skills and on better lifestyle choices such as having a healthy and balanced diet.

Health Screening and Follow Up services targetting seniors from rental blocks. NHS conducts free health screenings at two neighbourhoods, held over a weekend in both September and October. To reach out to residents-in-need, screenings target the rental block population which has a greater proportion of elderly and lower-income households.
Agency: Neighbourhood Health Service by Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine

The first e-platform the human would think of for HELP. Concurrent Text Counselling. 100% Accessible, Anonymous, Free of Charge, and Professional. Try somethingnew, rekindling hope, and providing assurance.


Uniting the SSA Community and diverse Social Service/Counselling centers, taking us to greater heights pertaining to productivity and efficiency. Digitalizing resources for our community's convenience.


Inspiring a generation of helpers to tackle mental health ails together as one. Supporting those in need and getting rid of stigmas within our society.

Through our exciting array of leisure and befriending activities organised by our dedicated befrienders, MINDS Me Too! Club enhances the social integration of persons with intellectual disabilities, where they build enduring relationships and memories with friends from all walks of life. There are parties, excursions, enrichment activities, befriending, customised respite care and online engagements. The Club continues to organise online meet-ups during this pandemic, and always ready to enfold new members.
Agency: Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS)
Scheme Type: Befriending for persons with intellectual disability

Scheme: Our Lives Our Voices (OLOV) Self-advocacy Programme
Description: A structured programme to help persons with intellectual disability know their rights, advocate for themselves, express their preferences and decisions, and build their confidence to engage with society as active citizens. Participants will also have the opportunity to meet like-minded individuals too.
Agency: Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS)

Scheme: Huggies Singapore Diaper Bank @ North West
Description: Free 6 packs of diapers for lower income households. Only for Singapore Citizens residing in North West District of Singapore are applicable for this scheme. Singapore PR with at least one Singaporean household members may also apply for the scheme. All submission is subject to North West (NW) CDC's approval. The type of diapers (ie: taped or pants) is subject to availability. NW CDC will inform successful applicant on the date of the delivery .

CRT is a ground-up community organisation which serves residents at Block 52 Cassia Crescent by engaging and befriending residents in the community.

The Enabling Guide is a first-stop resource portal for persons with disabilities and their caregivers to get information on disability schemes and services available in Singapore. The portal also guides users in making informed decisions about different service options across the life stages.

Healing Hearts has a group support programme, Transcending Divorce, an online group support programme for those who are seeking peer support and healing after divorce. Sign up at go.fycs.org/transcendingdivorce or email enq_healinghearts@fycs.org for other emotional support and counselling.

Scheme: Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs) and Strengthening Families Together@ Family Service Centres (FAM@FSCs)
Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs) and Strengthening Families Together@ Family Service Centres (FAM@FSCs)
Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs) and Strengthening Families Together@ Family Service Centres (FAM@FSCs)

Description:
ASSIST applies to divorced or widowed persons with children below age 16-- help with Flat allocation.
The flat allocation is up to 5% of BTO 2-room Flexi and 3-room flats in non-mature estates. This quota is shared with the 30% quota set aside for second-timers.

Scheme: Positive Parenting Program (Triple P) and Signposts
Description:
MSF has appointed ten Parenting Support Providers (PSPs) to deliver parenting support services on a regional basis. PSPs work closely with schools and community partners in their allocated regions to support parents through evidence-based parenting programmes and referrals to services depending on parentsí needs. 

The PSPs offer two evidence-based programmes ñ Positive Parenting Program (Triple P) and Signposts. To sign up, parents may contact the PSPs serving their childís school or their region or approach the childís school Teacher-In-Charge of Parenting Programmes.

Scheme: Children in Between (CiB) by Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs)
Description:
Children in Between is a programme for parents and their children who are between 6 to less than 15 years of age. 
The workshops under CiB cover topics for both parents and children. This free workshop is run by family counsellors from the Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs)/Strengthening Families Programme @Family Service Centres. Both parents and their children are encouraged to attend the workshops. You can contact a DSSA/FAM@FSC located near you to sign up for the programme. Please click here for a list of the agencies for their location and contact details 
List of centres: https://www.msf.gov.sg/divorce-support/Divorce-Support/Divorce-Support-Specialist-Agencies/Pages/dssa-locations.aspx
Contact Info
Email: fam_dssaprogrammes@msf.gov.sg

Scheme: THK Development Support and Learning Support (DS-LS)
Description:
THK Development Support and Learning Support Programme (THK DS-LS) is a community-based intervention programme for K1 and K2 children with mild developmental needs and learning needs.
We provide short-term support to children in their preschools in order to optimise their learning as well as increase their participation and integration in daily classroom activities and routines.

We provide short-term support to children in their preschools in order to optimise their learning as well as increase their participation and integration in daily classroom activities and routines.

Scheme: THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Circuit
Description:
THK CFH @ Circuit provides the following services to clients for a fee:
Counselling for children, youth, couples and families to enhance their overall well-being and quality of life.
Counselling for Problem Gambling for individuals and family members affected by problem gambling.
Personalised Theraplay focuses on natural patterns of playful and healthy interactions between parents and children to build strong family relationships.
Play Therapy is a method of therapy that uses play to support children in expressing their feelings and experiences.
Parenting Programmes:
(For parents whose children attend primary and secondary schools in the Boon Lay and Taman Jurong area)
Positive Parenting Programme (Triple P) ñ an evidence-based programme for parents who require support in parenting to prevent behavioural, emotional and developmental problems in children and teenagers.
Signposts ñ an evidence-based group programme to help parents understand and manage their childís behaviour.
Parents who are interested to register or need more information may read more about Triple P and Signposts here.
Please contact us should you have further queries on the Parenting Programmes: 67477514/ psp_jurong@thkmc.org.sg

THK CFH @ Circuit provides the following services to clients for a fee:
Counselling for children, youth, couples and families to enhance their overall well-being and quality of life.
Counselling for Problem Gambling for individuals and family members affected by problem gambling.
Personalised Theraplay focuses on natural patterns of playful and healthy interactions between parents and children to build strong family relationships.
Play Therapy is a method of therapy that uses play to support children in expressing their feelings and experiences.
Parenting Programmes:
(For parents whose children attend primary and secondary schools in the Boon Lay and Taman Jurong area)
Positive Parenting Programme (Triple P) ñ an evidence-based programme for parents who require support in parenting to prevent behavioural, emotional and developmental problems in children and teenagers.
Signposts ñ an evidence-based group programme to help parents understand and manage their childís behaviour.
Parents who are interested to register or need more information may read more about Triple P and Signposts here.
Please contact us should you have further queries on the Parenting Programmes: 67477514/ psp_jurong@thkmc.org.sg

Counselling for Problem Gambling for individuals and family members affected by problem gambling.
Personalised Theraplay focuses on natural patterns of playful and healthy interactions between parents and children to build strong family relationships.
Play Therapy is a method of therapy that uses play to support children in expressing their feelings and experiences.
Parenting Programmes:
(For parents whose children attend primary and secondary schools in the Boon Lay and Taman Jurong area)
Positive Parenting Programme (Triple P) ñ an evidence-based programme for parents who require support in parenting to prevent behavioural, emotional and developmental problems in children and teenagers.
Signposts ñ an evidence-based group programme to help parents understand and manage their childís behaviour.
Parents who are interested to register or need more information may read more about Triple P and Signposts here.
Please contact us should you have further queries on the Parenting Programmes: 67477514/ psp_jurong@thkmc.org.sg

Personalised Theraplay focuses on natural patterns of playful and healthy interactions between parents and children to build strong family relationships.
Play Therapy is a method of therapy that uses play to support children in expressing their feelings and experiences.
Parenting Programmes:
(For parents whose children attend primary and secondary schools in the Boon Lay and Taman Jurong area)
Positive Parenting Programme (Triple P) ñ an evidence-based programme for parents who require support in parenting to prevent behavioural, emotional and developmental problems in children and teenagers.
Signposts ñ an evidence-based group programme to help parents understand and manage their childís behaviour.
Parents who are interested to register or need more information may read more about Triple P and Signposts here.
Please contact us should you have further queries on the Parenting Programmes: 67477514/ psp_jurong@thkmc.org.sg

THK Family Service Centres (FSCs) are a key community-based focal point and social service provider for families in need. The objective of FSCs is to promote and improve the social well-being of every individual in the family, at every stage of life. FSCs are staffed with social workers and other professionals to provide a helping hand. Anyone, regardless of age, race, language or religion, can benefit from FSC services. THK currently runs 5 Family Service Centres.

The objective of FSCs is to promote and improve the social well-being of every individual in the family, at every stage of life. FSCs are staffed with social workers and other professionals to provide a helping hand. Anyone, regardless of age, race, language or religion, can benefit from FSC services. THK currently runs 5 Family Service Centres.

Scheme: THK Centre for Family Harmony @ Commonwealth
Description: THK Centre for Family Harmony @ Commonwealth is one of the six Divorce Support Specialist Agencies (DSSAs) that play a key role in supporting families and children who are affected by divorce. Initiated by the Ministry of Social and Family Development, the long term goal of the Divorce Support Specialist Agency is for families and their children to achieve stability and self-reliance.

Provides assessment and therapy for children with developmental issues, learning difficulties and physical disabilities from the ages of 0 to 18 years. These include children with, but not limited to:
Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder (ADHD)
Global Developmental Delay (GDD)
Sensory Processing Disorder (SPD)
Down Syndrome
Cerebral Palsy
Acquired/Traumatic Brain Injuries
Articulation and phonological delays and disorders (Speech Sound Disorders)
Childhood Apraxia of Speech (CAS)
Developmental Language Disorder (DLD)
Language Delay
Feeding/Eating difficulties
Hearing loss
Poor fine and gross motor skills
Behavioural and emotional issues
Social skills difficulties

THK Care Close to Home (C2H) Programme supports the frail and vulnerable seniors living in rental flats. The programme aims to provide a close-knitted social and health support within the community that will foster social inclusion and civic engagement allowing seniors in the community to age in place.

THK Community Befriending Programme provides psycho-social support to vulnerable elderly through our befriending services. Befrienders visit elderly regularly to keep loneliness and social isolation away. From these visits, our befrienders can identify other areas of need and inform the Programme Coordinators to refer the vulnerable elderly to other service providers.

THK Young at Heart was set up to cater to seniors living in Ang Mo Kio area and beyond. The centre promotes a sense of kampung spirit among the seniors and is one of THKís unique models that encourages volunteerism among members as they actively participate in running or contributing to the centreís activities.

THK Young at Heart aims to be a vibrant centre where seniors can stay cognitively alert and socially active. It also provides a platform where seniors can foster a life-long learning attitude in embracing new knowledge and skills as they age gracefully in place.

Seniors Activity Centres (SACs) are day centres for needy and vulnerable seniors. Currently, THK has 17 SACs across the island. These centres provide activities for seniors, keeping them active and socially integrated. Apart from providing socio-recreational programmes and activities. THK SACs also provide support services to frail and homebound elderly through befriending services, emergency alert response calls, information and referrals for eldercare related matters.

Encourage seniors to remain integrated in society through community outreach programmes and social recreational activities
Improve the quality of life of the seniors through engaging them in activities such as games challenge, art and craft sessions, festival celebrations, karaoke sessions, wellness programmes and regular outings
Promote active ageing and volunteerism among seniors

Basic monitoring and support services to maintain overall health status and ensure the seniorís safety within SGH
Care Coordination Service through liaising with the social and health service providers to access needed service (e.g. hospital admissions, medical appointments, counseling sessions, and so forth within the community and ensure their care needs are adequately addressed
Personal care such as assistance with medication reminders, linkages to external service providers can be made where necessary, to assist an optimal level of functioning

THK Home Care Services provide holistic and person centred care to the elderly who are mainly the needy and vulnerable, staying in the community. The focus of our services is to ensure the elderlyís health and Activities of Daily Living (ADLs) are optimized by delaying the onset and/or worsening of chronic illnesses e.g. diabetes, hypertension, dementia with the fine balance of healthy living.

Any adult with permanent disabilities or elderly who requires assistance with healthcare support in their homes.

Encourage seniors to remain integrated in society through community outreach programmes and social recreational activities

THK Home Help Services (HHS) were created to assist and support frail elderly to remain in their own homes for as long as possible, thereby enabling the elderly to ëage-in-placeí as well as to delay institutional care. THK Home Help Services (HHS) provide Meals on Wheels (MOW) and Medical Escort & Transport (MET) services. MOW prepares and delivers healthy meals to frail or elderly clients. MET provides medical escort services for the elderly, to accompany them safely for medical appointments and follow-up visits.

MET provides medical escort services for the elderly, to accompany them safely for medical appointments and follow-up visits.

THK Home Help Services (HHS) provide Meals on Wheels (MOW) and Medical Escort & Transport (MET) services. MOW prepares and delivers healthy meals to frail or elderly clients. MET provides medical escort services for the elderly, to accompany them safely for medical appointments and follow-up visits.

a. To provide social support through case management, monitoring, and basic counselling services to vulnerable seniors within the service boundary assigned by the Government; and
b. To facilitate better coordination in the provision of community-based care and support services to the seniors.

Vulnerable seniors receive adequate, timely and co-ordinated care and support; and vulnerable seniors have access to community resources and social support to live safely and independently in the community.

Vulnerable seniors receive adequate, timely and co-ordinated care and support; and vulnerable seniors have access to community resources and social support to live safely and independently in the community.

Objectives 
To raise awareness and educate residents about mental health issues
To match the residentsí needs with the services from both social and health agencies
To provide a holistic and comprehensive service to residents with mental health challenges
To support and lighten the burden of the caregiver

Core Services
Public education to increase public awareness of mental health
Educate for basic recognition of signs and symptoms of mental illness
Provide integrated care, information and support for clients and their families/caregivers
Network and Engagement of Community Partners
